job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
This Jobot Job is hosted by Matthew Wade
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.
Salary $110,000 - $160,000 per year
Based in Portland, OR we are fast growing, well-funded startup. We are a SD-WAN provider focused on optimizing access to the Cloud. We are looking to add the talent of a Software Engineering Manager. This person will report to our VP of Engineering and will manage and lead a team of 8 engineers. Our organization believes in servant leadership. We are seeking someone with a deep attitude of service towards co-workers and customers. We also believe in having fun while still pushing ourselves to grow as people.
What you’ll be doing
As a Site Reliability Engineer you’ll be working with our network operations, support, and development teams to resolve customer issues, build and maintain internal and public-facing infrastructure (hardware and software), and to identify and resolve system issues in a dynamic fast paced environment. We are looking for someone that believes that operations is a software problem and seeks to define prescriptive ways for measuring availability, uptime, outages, toil, etc.
Provide the first line of internal support for the Bigleaf server, OS, and software infrastructure, including triage of software, networking, resource, and security issues
Build, maintain, and deploy infrastructure for software and hardware systems
Maintain and extend the Bigleaf development environment including Linux tools, Bamboo, Puppet, Terraform, AWS, Azure and other cloud providers
Share ownership with developers by using the same tools and techniques across the stack
Have a formula for balancing accidents and failures against new releases
Encourage automation and minimize manual systems work to focus on efforts that bring long-term value to the system
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field involving software/systems engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting large-scale, public-facing, distributed systems.
Deep understanding of the Unix/Linux operating systems, including kernel networking packet flow
Strong understanding of network fundamentals, including tunneling (e.g. VPNs)
Working knowledge of SQL databases
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, supporting multiple concurrent projects
Experience with algorithms and data structures.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in a multi-team, collaborative environment
Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.
